sentences.english: The New Age person often prefers a direct spiritual experience rather than one from organized religion.
sentences.chinese: 新时代人经常宁爱直接的灵性体验胜过有组织的宗教。

sentences.english: In inner silence, we experience who we really are.
sentences.chinese: 内心静默时，我们正体验着我们真正是谁。

sentences.english: Bad sexual experiences are the ones students tend to discuss, Freitas said.
sentences.chinese: 糟糕的性体验是同学们热于讨论的话题之一。

sentences.english: Life is a collection of experiences. Let us be your guide.
sentences.chinese: 生活是繁复体验的集锦，让我们伴您探索。

sentences.english: We can actually go out and work in real jobs which is really great.
sentences.chinese: 我们能体验在工作中会遇到的问题，这一点很好。

sentences.english: Experience life in the form of nature.
sentences.chinese: 体验生活在自然的形式里。

sentences.english: We can reflect on our first order or base level experiences.
sentences.chinese: 我们能反思基层的体验。

sentences.english: Until now I have talked about the relation of dreams with the inexpressible .
sentences.chinese: 我目前已谈到梦与莫可名状的体验的关系。

sentences.english: You want an exceptional experience, not just an average one.
sentences.chinese: 你想要一个超常的体验，而不仅仅是常规的。

sentences.english: You need to savour this wine to get its full flavor.
sentences.chinese: 要想充分体验这种酒的醇美，你需要慢慢地去品尝。

sentences.english: Upon arrival you will have the local kampong style breakfast.
sentences.chinese: 抵达后，体验富有当地部落风俗的早餐。

sentences.english: This is how folks in my hometown see the world.
sentences.chinese: 这就是我们家乡人的体验。

sentences.english: Mahamudra is primordial wisdom that we experience through meditation.
sentences.chinese: “大手印”指的是我们通过禅修体验到的俱生智慧。

sentences.english: Content distinguish Bumin, the strong overall sense, user-friendly experience.
sentences.chinese: 内容区分布明了，整体感强烈，便于用户体验。

sentences.english: You have to have success and failure.
sentences.chinese: 你必须经受成功与失败的体验。

sentences.english: It’s safe to say that lucid dreams are unlike anything else you’ve ever experienced.
sentences.chinese: 可以肯定地说，清醒梦会给你带来全新的体验。

definition: to sense/perception/to feel (through the senses)/to experience/a feeling/an impression/an experience
(idiom) to experience it for oneself/to actually *be* there (as opposed to reading about it etc)
to enjoy/to live it up/pleasure/CL:種|种[zhong3]
to know from experience/to learn through experience/to realize/understanding/experience
to give to/to provide to/to bring to/to take to
to have a taste of/to realize/to appreciate
the feeling of actually being there
